pullRequest.body:
Also:
* make `condExp_const` a simp lemma
* rename `condExp_undef` to `condExp_of_not_integrable` (there are many ways in which `condExp` is undefined other than the function not being integrable)
* specialise `eLpNorm_condExp_le` and `Mem‚Ñíp.condExp` to real inner product spaces as otherwise `ùïú` is unconstrained by the return type
* add a TODO

From my PhD (LeanCamCombi)


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0ccd8671d2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21001/commits/0ccd8671d24bde63fcfe9ddff30679bc5a53913f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ condExp_ofNat`
`+ condExp_of_not_integrable`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Why `n.AtLeastTwo`? The result should be true for 0 and 1 as well.
Also, do we really need that lemma? It looks like a `condExp_const_mul` lemma about multiplication by a real constant would be equally applicable here, and more general.

> Why `n.AtLeastTwo`? The result should be true for 0 and 1 as well.

The generic `OfNat n` instance is only available under the hypothesis `n.AtLeastTwo`. The result for `0` and `1` must be stated separately (and I didn't state them because they are a bit silly)

> do we really need that lemma? It looks like a `condExp_const_mul` lemma about multiplication by a real constant would be equally applicable here, and more general.

Morally, yes. Syntactically, no. My use case, turning `Œº[2 * f|m]` into `2 * Œº[f|m]`, is not syntactically about multiplication by a real constant
Are you certain that you want to un-generalise this lemma? It seems more useful to make `ùïú` explicit here, rather than specialising the statement

Any `ùïú`-inner product space for `RCLike ùïú` is a real inner product space (see [`InnerProductSpace.rclikeToReal`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/InnerProductSpace/Basic.html#InnerProductSpace.rclikeToReal), so this is no loss in generality

Furthermore, this "ungeneralisation" is not a new pattern. Searching for `[InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù` yields 98 hits in 56 files
But this is not a simp lemma?
Don't you want it to be a simp lemma?
I don't really mind. I guess it could be one, yes

pullRequest.title: feat: `Œº[ofNat n * f|m] =·µê[Œº] ofNat n * Œº[f|m]`
